Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
Might be a stupid question:
Does gateway know about assets and oracles at the source code of KMD level or the info about assets and info from oracles need to be extracted by a dAPP and sent to gateway outside of KMD source code?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Gateway binding with oracle and asset (token) on creation step:
` ./komodo-cli -ac_name=ORCL1 gatewaysbind <tokenid> <oracleid> <coinname> <tokensupply> 1 1 <trustedpubkey>`
Oraclefeed dAPP grab data and publish to oracle on chain by `oraclesdata` . Then gateway using data from binded oracle for proof the deposit/withdrawal

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
`./komodo-cli gatewaysdeposit bindtxid height coin cointxid claimvout deposithex proof destpub amount`
You have to declare height in your deposit call and it's checking for such height oraclized in binded oracle (not checked this part of sourcecode - I guess it's using `oraclessamples` call)

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
I think what I was trying to ask was: 
Does the `komodod` when using gateways cc, access the oracle data that is there in the blockchain by itself or does the gateways cc (komodod) need to be fed the oracle data from the outside?(Like through a rpc call)
Looking at the command you posted above, it seems that we just need to give the `oracleid`  to gateways and komodod will access the data by itself from the blockchain

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: gatewaysCC access the data by itself from the blockchain (oracleCC) when you doing calls which require such data. Data from outside to blockchain (to oracle) "grabbing" by `oraclefeed` dAPP

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@siu - Chainmakers hi and thanks for a feedback! At the moment only possible to prepare the gateway for transactions:
```[0] Create token
[1] Get list of availiable tokens
[2] Create oracle
[3] Oracle subscription UTXOs generator
[4] Get list of availiable oracles
[5] Tokens converter
[6] Bind gateway```

Content: you need to have a claimvout that matches the address you want to receive the tokens with

Content: on withdraw, you specify an arbitrary withdraw address so it has absolutely nothing to do with the deposit

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: just filled one of gaps in flow understanding

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at the code level all that is happening is that the CC is checking that the claimvout in the deposit goes to the same address as the claiming node's pubkey

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if not, it is rejected

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the reason should be clear. why is this restriction there?

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not exactly a secure deposit process that we need

Content: But I've added it via `importaddress` and daemon started with other pubkey parameter: `-pubkey=030cb918b90dc084cdb08fcda4297d0db9c86422987df0cafa47ffef57eb6ef647`

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the node needs to be running with that -pubkey=

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: otherwise as far as the CC is concerned it is not that node's address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one address/pubkey per node, regardless of if it is in the wallet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: any node that isnt -pubkey= 021a559101e355c907d9c553671044d619769a6e71d624f68bfec7d0afa6bd6a96

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: will be treated as invalid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also the privkey for 021a559101e355c907d9c553671044d619769a6e71d624f68bfec7d0afa6bd6a96 must be in the wallet, or you cant access those funds

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I thought validation is only on wallet level üôÅ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well it could be, but it isny

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: isnt

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: my reason is that each new CC eval code creates a new address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with no easy way to map the address to the pubkey as it is based on a hash

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so if to allow all addresses in the wallet, then all addresses need to be mapped to all possible CC outputs and then each time to sign a tx all vins compared against all addresses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is possible, but not implemented
